I am using ODBC.jl (Julia x86, win10) to connect to an old MS Access DB *.mde file and query dataframes from it, but seem there are cells with Cyrillic text, and I get wrong encoding from it. Setting locale identifiers into connection string doesn't help. Can it be solved on Julia side, or should I dig into Access properties?
```using ODBC

conn_str  = "Driver={Microsoft Access Driver (*.mdb)};Dbq=$dbfile;Uid=Admin;Pwd=;"
#conn_str  = "Driver={Microsoft Access Driver (*.mdb)};Dbq=C:\mydatabase.mde;Locale Identifier=1049;Uid=Admin;Pwd=;" # ru-RU locales

conn = ODBC.Connection(conn_str)

df = DBInterface.execute(conn, "SELECT * from DefFil") |> DataFrame```
I get the following data:
```julia> select(df, :text_cnp)
22042×1 DataFrame
   Row │ text_cnp
       │ String?
───────┼───────────────────────────────────
     1 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     2 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     3 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     4 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     5 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     6 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     7 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…
     8 │ \r\n\r\n   \xc8\xf1\xf1\xeb\xe5\…```
